body:
Reproduced locally:

```
#0  0x00007ffff6f07c37 in __GI_raise (sig=sig@entry=6) at ../nptl/sysdeps/unix/sysv/linux/raise.c:56
#1  0x00007ffff6f0b028 in __GI_abort () at abort.c:89
#2  0x00007ffff46ce3ae in current_ctx () at src/core/ext/client_config/subchannel_index.c:70
#3  0x00007ffff46ce725 in sck_avl_destroy (p=0x7fffe4002ac0) at src/core/ext/client_config/subchannel_index.c:136
#4  0x00007ffff4664d71 in unref_node (vtable=0x7ffff4a71b20 <subchannel_avl_vtable>, node=0x7fffe4002bc0) at src/core/lib/support/avl.c:62
#5  0x00007ffff4665cbb in gpr_avl_unref (avl=...) at src/core/lib/support/avl.c:297
#6  0x00007ffff46ce871 in grpc_subchannel_index_shutdown () at src/core/ext/client_config/subchannel_index.c:169
#7  0x00007ffff46cacf1 in grpc_client_config_shutdown () at src/core/ext/client_config/client_config_plugin.c:91
#8  0x00007ffff466d87d in grpc_shutdown () at src/core/lib/surface/init.c:203
#9  0x0000000000558219 in call_ll_exitfuncs () at ../Python/pythonrun.c:1768
#10 0x0000000000554b76 in Py_Finalize () at ../Python/pythonrun.c:559
#11 0x0000000000570e8e in Py_Main (argc=4, argv=0x7fffffffda18) at ../Modules/main.c:665
#12 0x0000000000417fbd in main (argc=4, argv=0x7fffffffda18) at ../Modules/python.c:23
```

It looks like this issue is still active after #7275 was merged:
https://grpc-testing.appspot.com/view/Pull%20requests/job/gRPC_interop_pull_requests/6233/

I was able to reproduce it on the master branch, but unable to reproduce it on #7157, more investigation is needed.

It looks like the issue emerges when the `channel_spin_thread` exits before the main thread exits.  The `CleanupThread` object gets cleaned up in the `channel_spin_thread pthread`, but the `channel_spin_thread` is already considered joined() by Python when this occurs, and so the main thread is free to proceed to `grpc_shutdown`:

